sentences.english: He declined your offer with thanks.
sentences.chinese: 他对你的馈赠婉言谢绝了。

sentences.english: They offered him some money, which he refused politely.
sentences.chinese: 他们要给他一些钱，他婉言拒绝了。
我婉言谢绝了他们的邀请。

sentences.english: He graciously declined all the visits.
sentences.chinese: 他婉言谢绝了一切来访。

sentences.english: I thanked her but still refused to accept.
Molly chose a better house for him at first but he declined it with thanks.
sentences.chinese: 茉莉本来选了一所较大的房子，却被他婉言谢绝了。

sentences.english: When he asked me to dance, I declined politely.
sentences.chinese: 当他邀请我跳舞时，我婉言拒绝了。

sentences.english: The subject of this eulogy murmured something deprecatory .
sentences.chinese: 这颂扬声里婉言低语某些贬抑的主题东西。

sentences.english: I invited John to join us, but he declined.
sentences.chinese: 我邀请约翰和我们在一起，可是他婉言谢绝了。

sentences.english: They also invited me to stay for supper. But thinking of the football match, I refused them politely.
sentences.chinese: 他们留我吃晚饭，但想着足球比赛我婉言拒绝了。

sentences.english: I invited her to join us, but she declined.
sentences.chinese: 我邀请她加入我们，可是她婉言拒绝了。

sentences.english: A prosperous 12 family in the community offered him free room and board.
sentences.chinese: 社区里的一个富户免费给他提供吃住，但他婉言谢绝。
她婉言谢绝参加他们的活动。

sentences.english: Although it was a very high position, he graciously refused it.
sentences.chinese: 虽然这个官位很高，但他还是婉言拒绝了。

definition: a branch of the Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/two-character surname Murong
to regret leaving/reluctant to part/(onom.) young leaves stir gently in the wind
junior female student or apprentice/daughter (younger than oneself) of one's teacher
uncle (affectionate name for a friend older than one's father)/old friend
homophone group (group of homophone characters, in a rhyme book)
to have a smile on one's face
lord/master/young gentleman/male prostitute/catamite/mahjong player disqualified by unintentionally taking in the wrong number of dominoes/(old form of address for one's husband) husband
